section.sentence: A large tree grew next to a creek from which there were some thin reeds.
“Hah ha!” Cried the tree, “I am so tall and ________. Though the wind passes through my branches, I still remain strong.”
“You, silly reeds, bend so easily. I must be the strongest in the ______.”
The reeds shook their heads, “We bend to the wind, so we do not break,” they replied.
“You should worry about yourself, so strong and stubborn. You will snap!” the reeds continued.
As the reeds whispered this _______, a great thunderstorm rose over the hill and down the valley.
The reeds did ___ to the wind, dancing gracefully through the storm.
The proud oak, so strong and stubborn, shook at the wind and _______ into the creek below.
